rows.translation: I CALL TO witness those who stand arrayed in rows,

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.

rows.translation: And those who restrain by reprimanding,
And those who recite the Reminder,
Verily your God is One,

rows.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
rows.translation: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, and the Lord of the Easts.
rows.transliteration: rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā warabbul mashāriq

rows.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
rows.translation: He decked the nearest heavens with ornaments of stars,
Protecting them against every wayward devil,

rows.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
rows.translation: So that they are not able to listen to the angels of higher (echelons), and are pelted from all sides
rows.transliteration: lā yassamma`ūna ilal-mala-il-a`lā wayuqdhafūna min kulli jānib

rows.translation: And kept far away. There is perpetual punishment for them,

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
rows.translation: Except those who eavesdrop and are pursued by a shooting flame.
rows.transliteration: illā man khaṭifal khaṭfata fa-atba`ahu shihābun thāqib

rows.arabic: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍۭ
rows.translation: So ask them if they are more difficult to create, or the rest We have created? Indeed (man) We created from fermented clay.
rows.transliteration: fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnā ۚ innā khalaqnāhum min ṭīnin lāzib

rows.translation: Yet while you are filled with wonder, they just scoff;
And when they are warned they pay no heed.
When they see a sign, they laugh at it,

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And say: "This is only magic.
rows.transliteration: waqālū in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīn

rows.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
rows.translation: When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, how can we be raised again,
rows.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

rows.translation: And our fathers too?"
You say: "Yes; and you will be lowly made."

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: There will only be a single jerk, and they will gape,
rows.transliteration: fa-innamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun fa-idhā hum yanẓurūn

rows.translation: And say: "Ah woe! This is the Day of Reckoning."

rows.arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
rows.translation: "(Yes,) this is the Day of Judgement you had called a lie."
rows.transliteration: hādhā yawmul faṣlil ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: Gather all the wicked together and their comrades, and those they had worshipped
rows.transliteration: uḥ-shurul ladhīna ẓalamū wa-azwājahum wa mā kānū ya`budūn

rows.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: Other than God," (the angels will be told), "then show them the way to Hell,
rows.transliteration: min dūnillāhi fahdūhum ilā ṣirāṭil jaḥīm

rows.translation: And detain them, for they will be questioned."
"What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?"
They will submit to questioning then,
And some of them will confront the others,

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
rows.translation: Saying: "It were you who imposed yourselves upon us."
They will say: "No, you were the ones who would not believe.

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَـٰغِينَ
rows.translation: We had no power over you. In fact, you were a people rebellious.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna lanā `alaykum min sulṭān ۖ bal kuntum qawman ṭāghīn

rows.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
rows.translation: The sentence of our Lord has come true for us. We have certainly to taste (the punishment),
For we had led you astray. In fact we ourselves were astray."
So, they will become partners in punishment.
That is how We deal with sinners.

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
rows.translation: They were those who, when it was said to them, "There is no god but God," behaved with insolence,
rows.transliteration: innahum kānū idhā qīla lahum lā ilāha illallāhu yastakbirūn

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
rows.translation: And said: "Should we abandon our gods for the sake of an insane poet?"
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlūna a-innā latārikū ālihatinā lishā`irin majnūn

rows.translation: Not in the least. He has brought the truth and confirmed the other messengers.
rows.transliteration: bal jā-a bil ḥaqqi waṣaddaqal mursalīn

rows.translation: You will indeed taste a painful punishment,

rows.arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And be rewarded but only for what you had done,
rows.transliteration: wa mā tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.translation: Except the chosen creatures of God,
Whose provision is predetermined --
Fruits of every kind, and they will be honoured
In gardens of delight,
(Sitting) on couches, face to face,
With cups from a flowing stream being passed around,
Clear, delicious to drink,

rows.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
rows.translation: Neither dulling the senses nor intoxicating,
rows.transliteration: lā fīhā ghawlun walā hum `anhā yunzafūn

rows.translation: And with them maidens of modest look and large lustrous eyes,
Like sheltered eggs in a nest.
Then one turned to the other in an enquiry.

rows.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
rows.translation: Said one of the speakers: "I had a friend
rows.transliteration: qāla qā-ilun minhum innī kāna lī qarīn

rows.translation: Who used to say: 'Are you one of those who can testify to the truth?

rows.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
rows.translation: (Do you think) we would be paid back our due when we are dead and reduced to dust and bones?'
rows.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamadīnūn

rows.translation: He said: 'Will you look down?'
He looked down and saw (his friend) in the midst of Hell.
'By God', he said, 'you had almost ruined me.

rows.arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
rows.translation: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord I too would have been there (in Hell).
rows.transliteration: walawlā ni`matu rabbī lakuntu minal muḥḍarīn

rows.translation: (Another will say:)"Is it true, we are not going to die

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
rows.translation: Other than our first death, and we shall not be punished?
rows.transliteration: illā mawtatanal-ūlā wa mā naḥnu bimu`adhhabīn

rows.translation: This will indeed be great happiness.
For this the toilers should strive."

rows.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
rows.translation: Is this better or the tree of Zaqqum
rows.transliteration: adhālika khayrun nuzulan am shajaratuz zaqqūm

rows.translation: Which We have reserved as punishment for evil-doers?

rows.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: It is a tree that grows at the bottom of Hell.
rows.transliteration: innahā shajaratun takhruju fī aṣlil jaḥīm

rows.translation: Its spathes are like the prickly pear.

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
rows.translation: They will eat and fill their bellies with it,
rows.transliteration: fa-innahum la-ākilūna minhā famāli-ūna minhal buṭūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
rows.translation: Washing it down with boiling water.
rows.transliteration: thumma inna lahum `alayhā lashawban min ḥamīm

rows.translation: Then to Hell they will surely be returned.
They had found their fathers astray,
Yet they hasten to follow in their footsteps.
So had many an earlier people gone astray,
And We had sent admonishers to them.
Look, then how was the end of those who had been warned,
Other than the chosen creatures of God.
Noah had verily called to Us. And how gracious was He who answered (him).
We saved him and his family from the great affliction,
And made his progeny survive,
And left (his name) for posterity.
Peace on Noah among all men.
That is how We reward those who do good.
Surely he was among Our faithful creatures.
Afterwards We drowned the others.
And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,
When he came to his Lord with a heart compliant,

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: When he said to his father and his people: "What is this you worship?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mādhā ta`budūn

rows.translation: Why do you solicit false gods instead of God?
What do you imagine the Lord of the worlds to be?"
Then he looked up at the stars (they worshipped),
And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"
But they turned their backs on him and went away.

rows.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: Then he turned towards their gods and said: "Why do you not eat (of these offerings)?
rows.transliteration: farāgha ilā ālihatihim faqāla alā ta-kulūn

rows.translation: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"
Then he started striking them down with his right hand.
So the people descended upon him.
"Why do you worship these you carve yourselves," he asked,
"When God has created you and what you make?"

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: "Build a pyre for him and throw him into the raging fire."
rows.transliteration: qālub-nū lahu bunyānan fa-alqūhu fil jaḥīm

rows.translation: So they contrived a plot against him, but We made them abject.

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
rows.translation: And he said: "I am going away to my Lord who will show me the way.
rows.transliteration: waqāla innī dhāhibun ilā rabbī sayahdīn

rows.translation: (And he prayed:) "O Lord, grant me a righteous son."
So We gave him the good news of a clement son.

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: When he was old enough to go about with him, he said: "O my son, I dreamt that I was sacrificing you. Consider, what you think?" He replied: "Father, do as you are commanded. If God pleases you will find me firm."
rows.transliteration: falammā balagha ma`ahus sa`ya qāla yābunayya innī arā fil manāmi annī adhbaḥuka fanẓur mādhā tarā ۚ qāla yā-abatif-`al mā tu-mar ۖ satajidunī in shā-allāhu minaṣ ṣābirīn

rows.translation: When they submitted to the will of God, and (Abraham) laid (his son) down prostrate on his temple,
We called out: "O Abraham,

rows.arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: You have fulfilled your dream." Thus do We reward the good.
rows.transliteration: qad ṣaddaqtar ru-yā ۚ innā kadhālika najzil muḥsinīn

rows.translation: That was indeed a trying test.
So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice,
And left (his hallowed memory) for posterity.
Peace be on Abraham.
That is how We reward those who do good.
He is truly among Our faithful creatures.
So We gave him the good news of Isaac, apostle, who is among the righteous.

rows.arabic: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
rows.translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants are some who do good, but some who wrong themselves.
rows.transliteration: wabāraknā `alayhi wa`alā is-ḥāq ۚ wa min dhurriyyatihimā muḥsinun waẓālimul linafsihi mubīn

rows.translation: We were indeed gracious to Moses and Aaron,
And saved them and their people from great distress,
And helped them, so they were victorious.
We gave them the explicit Book,
And showed them the straight path,
And left (their remembrance) for posterity.
Peace be on Moses and Aaron.
That is how We reward those who do good.
They are among Our faithful devotees.
Verily Elias is one of the apostles.
When he said to his people: "Will you not be mindful of God?
Would you call on Baal and leave the best of creators,
God, your Lord, and the Lord of your fathers?"
They denied him, and will surely be brought to punishment,
Except the chosen creatures of God.
And We left his (memory) for posterity.
Peace be on Elias.
That is how We reward those who do good.
He is truly among Our faithful devotees.
Verily Lot was one of the apostles,
Wherefore We saved him and his entire family
Except an old woman who was one of those who stayed behind.
Then We destroyed the others.
You pass by (their habitations) in the morning
Or at night. Then how is it you do not understand?
Verily Jonah is one of the apostles.
When he fled on the laden ship,
And lots were cast (when a storm overtook them), he was rejected, (and thrown overboard).
Then he was swallowed by a large fish as he was worthy of blame.
Had he not been one of those who struggled hard,

rows.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: He would have stayed in its belly till the day the dead are raised.
rows.transliteration: lalabitha fī baṭnihi ilā yawmi yub`athūn

rows.translation: So We cast him, sick, on a barren shore,
And We made a gourd tree grow over him.

rows.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
rows.translation: We sent him to a hundred thousand men or more,
rows.transliteration: wa-arsalnāhu ilā mī-ati alfin aw yazīdūn

rows.translation: And they came to believe; so We allowed them to enjoy the good things of life for an age.
Now ask them if their Lord has daughters, and they sons?

rows.arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَـٰثًا وَهُمْ شَـٰهِدُونَ
rows.translation: Or did We make the angels females, and they witnessed it?
rows.transliteration: am khalaqnal malā-ikata ināthan wahum shāhidūn

rows.translation: Is it not a lie invented by them when they say:
"God has begotten (children)?" They are liars indeed!
Does He prefer sons to daughters?
What ails you that you judge in such a wise?
Why do you not reflect?
Or have you received some clear authority?
Then bring your scripture, if what you say is true.

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
rows.translation: They link Him with jinns by lineage, yet the jinns know they will be brought before Him.
rows.transliteration: waja`alū baynahu wabaynal jinnati nasabā ۚ walaqad `alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuḥḍarūn

rows.translation: God is too glorious for what they ascribe to Him
Except His chosen creatures who do not.
So neither you nor those you worship
Can mislead anyone away from Him,
Except one who is (destined) to burn in Hell.

rows.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
rows.translation: "There is not one of us who does not have his appointed place," (declare the angels.)
rows.transliteration: wa mā minnā illā lahu maqāmun ma`lūm

rows.translation: "And we are truly those who stand in rows,
And we are those who sing hallelujas to Him."
They used to say:

rows.arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: If we had the account of earlier people with us,
We would have been the chosen creatures of God."
Yet now (that it has come) they refuse to believe in it; but they will come to know soon.
Our word had already been given before to Our votaries, the apostles, --
That they would be helped,
And that certainly Our armies will be victorious.
So you ignore them for a time
And wait; they will come to know soon.
Do they want to hasten Our punishment?

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
rows.translation: When it comes down on their plains, it will be an evil dawn for those who had been warned.
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā nazala bisāḥatihim fasā-a ṣabāḥul mundharīn

rows.translation: So turn away from them for a time
And watch; they will come to know soon.

rows.arabic: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: Too glorious is your Lord, the Lord of power, for what they ascribe to Him.
So peace be on the messengers,
And all praise to God, the Lord of all the worlds.
